item.title: Design Patterns: Decorator
item.description:
General

Decorator. Hoorrayyy, it’s first article in Design Patterns.

I want to describe patterns, use cases, and examples, and nuances.

Decorator Pattern

Introduction

The Decorator pattern is one of the structural design patterns. It allows us to dynamically extend the behavior of objects without modifying their structure. This pattern is widely used when we need to add responsibilities to objects in a flexible and reusable way.

Key Concepts

  1. Abstract component – Defines the base interface.
  2. Concrete component – A basic implementation of the component.
  3. Decorator (Wrapper) – Inherits from the base component and adds new behavior.

item.title: Between The Lines: Vertex Animations
item.description:
Chapter 1: Animation concept

Let’s start by explaining how animation will work for our UI elements.

We are not talking here about transitions/delays and other built-in animation features in UI Toolkit.

From previous articles, we have already learnt how to create customisable UI elements. Now it’s time to add some dynamism.

It is worth noting that animation generation is quite resource-intensive compared to other operations, as it will load the CPU on almost every frame.

Usage
